abstract: First screened on the Ten Network, Part One of this four part mini-series focusing on the Goddard family during the Vietnam War years 1964-1972.
description: "Featuring an award-winning performance from a young Nicole Kidman. An epic story of Australia's involvement in the Vietnam war as told by the Goddard family whose son Phillip (Nicholas Eadie), is conscripted to fight in the war and whose father, Douglas (Barry Otto), is one of the key Canberra bureaucrats responsible for the policy of Australia's involvement in the war. Tracing their personal lives and career paths during the dramas thrown up by the war in Vietnam, this classic mini-series tells the epic story of Australia's involvement in the Vietnam War through the history of a middle class family the Goddards." Source: The Australian Film and Television Companion.  In part one of this epic mini-series, ambivalent Phil and headstrong Megan are siblings growing up in Canberra during the Vietnam War. Conscription throws Phil into the army, while schoolgirl Megan feels the first stirrings of love.
